Text:
Thanks! To you and the polite commenter!

I wish Erl Stanley Gardner's A.A. Fair Lam & Cool novels were that available.

I'd exclaim "fry me for an oyster!" if a bunch of the many showed up. [That's Bertha Cool.]

When Gardner's Masons had the market flooded (due to his novel factory) he needed a pen name and new characters to keep busy, so out came his most enjoyable stuff, I'd say.

Sweet Jesus. wearehidden, do you sometimes wear a red suit, a white beard and laugh un controllable? If so I think I know who you are. Thanks again. Mr Greene would be pleased. In return I can offer a membership to a arthouse film peer to peer site that has no equal,,,, interested?
